intro: Althoffia saccifera, commonly known as the bladderfruit or bladderpod, is a flowering plant native to parts of Africa and Asia. It belongs to the family Brassicaceae, which includes mustard and cress plants. The plant is characterized by its unique, inflated fruit that resembles a small bladder, hence its common name. Its flowers are small and yellow, typically arranged in clusters, and it produces a pungent odor when crushed. Althoffia saccifera is often found in disturbed soils and can thrive in a variety of habitats, including roadsides and open fields.
